Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Fox News "posts a fake picture" when in fact, other news outlets also ran the image.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or sources to back up the accusation that Fox News intentionally used a doctored image.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the presence of the Universal Studios sign in the background of the photo proves that it is fake, without considering alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the presence of the Universal Studios sign, as it could be a coincidence or a sign from a different location.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the photo was taken by an AFP photographer during Trump's visit to Afghanistan, suggesting that it was not staged.
Understate: The claim may understate the possibility that the image was used by multiple news outlets, not just Fox News.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by relying on a Facebook post and not providing additional evidence or expert analysis to support its accusation.
